page.title: 18The Parish of St. Clement
page.content: Most of the land we covered in our Domesday survey was in the parish of St Clement. The Parish of St Clement is the smallest of the twelve parishes in Jersey and it is also one of the most fertile. The area of the Parish of St Clement is only 1044 acres. It extends from Le Dicq to La Rocque pier. The parish of St Clement is divided into three separate Vingtaines (subdivisions of the parish) Samares, Rocquier and the Grande Vingtaine. The largest of the Vingtaines is Samares. The parish St. Clement is named after Clement 1, the Bishop of Rome in A.D. 92. The legend of St. Clement is that he was thrown into the Black Sea with his neck chained to an anchor. That is why the emblem of the parish of St. Clement is an anchor.
